file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 34-27-03-04 - DUAL IRS - FAN - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL DUAL IRS - FAN - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to remove/install the IRS fan. B. The IRS 1 fan is installed on the left side of the electronic compartment. C. The IRS 2 fan is installed on the right side of the electronic compartment. D. The access to the IRS 1 fan and IRS 2 fan is got through 113CZ access panel in the electronic compartment. E. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 34-27-03-000-801-A IRS FAN - REMOVAL ALL 34-27-03-400-801-A IRS FAN - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 34-27-03 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-27-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. IRS FAN - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the IRS fan. (2) The IRS fans are installed on the related IRS mounting racks. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-27-01-000-801-A/400 IRU - REMOVAL SB145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 213 113CZ LH Electronic Compartment 214 113CZ RH Electronic Compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Electronic Compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, open the IRS 1 and/or IRS 2 circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to them. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-27-03 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) On aircraft PRE-MOD SB145-32-0036, make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system 1 is fully released ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (3) On aircraft POST-MOD SB145-32-0036, install the safety pin of the NLG door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (4) Open access door 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (5) Remove IRS 1 and/or IRS 2 ( AMM TASK 34-27-01-000-801-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the fan filter (Pull the tab to disconnect the filter from the fan). (2) Disconnect the two wires (one red and one black) that come out of the fan housing. (3) Turn the rim clamps until the flat edge of each clamp points to the fan. (4) Disconnect the fan from the mounting plate. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-27-03 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL IRS Fan - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 213 214 DET. A B IRS MOUNTING RACK 1. IRS FAN 2. SCREW (4) DET. B (TYPICAL) 145AMM340339.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-27-03 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-27-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. IRS FAN - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the IRS Fan. (2) The IRS fans are installed on the related IRS mounting racks. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-21-01-400-801-A/400 AHRS COMPUTER - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 34-27-03-700-801-A/500 IRS FAN - OPERATIONAL TEST SB145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 213 113CZ LH Electronic Compartment 214 113CZ RH Electronic Compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Electronic Compartment I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the fan in position on the mounting tray. Make sure that the AIRFLOW arrow on the fan points down. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-27-03 Page 5 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Attach the fan to the base of the tray with three rim clamps. Make sure that the flat edge of the rim clamp points away from the fan. (3) Connect the red wire to a 28 V DC source. (4) Connect the black wire to the ground source. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install IRS 1 and/or IRS 2 ( AMM TASK 34-21-01-400-801-A/400). (2) Close access panel 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (3) On aircraft POST-MOD SB145-32-0036, remove the safety pin of the NLG door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (4) On the circuit breaker panel, close the IRS 1 and/or IRS 2 circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from them. (5) Do the IRS fan operational test ( AMM TASK 34-27-03-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-27-03 Page 6 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
